context: The Estonian word 'õde' has three main meanings: 1) sister - a female sibling, 2) a fellow woman or member of a community (like a classmate or colleague), and 3) nurse - a healthcare professional who carries out medical orders. As shown in the examples, it can refer to biological sisters (Mari is Jüri's sister), multiple sisters (Reet and Maire are sisters), or a nurse who performs medical procedures (The sister gave an injection, bandaged the wound).
